content:
Find where oracle, librarian, and explore agents are defined in oh-my-opencode. Check:
1. ~/.config/opencode/ directory for any config files
2. Any node_modules or bun cache where oh-my-opencode is installed
3. Look for agent definitions, default models, prompts

Return file paths and relevant snippets.

Title: Oh My OpenCode (5 SUPER Agent/MCP/Prompt Config) - YouTube
Author: AICodeKing
Published Date: 2025-12-27T00:00:00.000Z
URL: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uuV1DcvObsg
Text: In this video, I introduce \"Oh My OpenCode,\" an AI coding agent framework that orchestrates multiple specialized AI models for complex development tasks. Discover how it delegates work, uses different models for their unique strengths, and tackles common pain points in AI coding workflows with features like parallel processing and real-time error correction.\n\n--\nKey Takeaways:\n\nðŸš€ Oh My OpenCode is a new AI coding agent framework that orchestrates multiple specialized models for development.\nðŸ§  It solves the \"mono-model\" workflow problem by treating a main agent (Sisyphus) as an \"Engineering Manager\" that delegates tasks.\nðŸ› ï¸ Sisyphus delegates to specialized sub-agents like a \"Frontend Engineer\" (Gemini), \"Librarian\" (Sonnet), and \"Oracle\" (GPT) based on task needs.\nâš¡ Key features incl

# Agents
Configure and use specialized agents.
Agents are specialized AI assistants that can be configured for specific tasks and workflows. They allow you to create focused tools with custom prompts, models, and tool access.
Tip
Use the plan agent to analyze code and review suggestions without making any code changes.
You can switch between agents during a session or invoke them with the`@`mention.
## [Types](#types)
There are two types of agents in OpenCode; primary agents and subagents.
### [Primary agents](#primary-agents)
Primary agents are the main assistants you interact wi

# How Coding Agents Actually Work: Inside OpenCode
A hands-on exploration of OpenCode, an open-source coding agent built with a client/server architecture. Learn how AI tools, LLMs, and real-world constraints come together to create a powerful developer experience.
PostedSep 14, 2025
By*[Moncef Abboud |**](https://twitter.com/moncef_abboud)*

Title: Run AI Agents Anywhere with Open Agent Specification (Oracle x ...
Author: LauzHack
Published Date: 2025-11-18T00:00:00.000Z
URL: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=--21Vs7HU_A
Text: Materials: https://github.com/LauzHack/oracle-ag...\nOracle's Agent Specification: https://github.com/oracle/agent-spec\n\nInterested in designing your own AI agents and automation flows? This talk introduces Open Agent Specification, an Open Source standard that allows you to easily create, share, and deploy AI agents and automation flows across different platforms and environments. You'll see how advanced features, like multi-agent collaboration and retrieval-augmented generation (RAG), can be built and reused, making your projects more flexible and impactful. You'll gain insights into leveraging this open specification for creating robust, portable agents and deploying them efficiently across agent platforms. Join us to explore how Agent Spec empowers you to innovate and build real-world AI soluti

## Oh My OpenCode (5 SUPER Agent/MCP/Prompt Config) - YouTube

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uuV1DcvObsg

In this video, I introduce \"Oh My OpenCode,\" an AI coding agent framework that orchestrates multiple specialized AI models for complex development tasks. Discover how it delegates work, uses different models for their unique strengths, and tackles common pain points in AI coding workflows with features like parallel processing and real-time error correction.\n\n--\nKey Takeaways:\n\nðŸš€ Oh My OpenCode is a new AI coding agent framework that orchestrates multiple specialized models for development.\nðŸ§  It solves the \"mono-model\" workflow problem by treating a main agent (Sisyphus) as an \"Engineering Manager\" that delegates tasks.\nðŸ› ï¸ Sisyphus delegates to specialized sub-agents like a \"Frontend Engineer\" (Gemini), \"Librarian\" (Sonnet), and \"Oracle\" (GPT) based on task needs.\nâš¡ Key features include asynchronous background task execution, a \"Todo Continuation Enforcer,\" and LSP integration for real-time diagnostics and error fixing.\nâœ¨ The system demonstrates impressive self-correction and resilience, catching and fixing its own errors during the coding process.\nðŸ’¸ While powerful, it requires access to multiple API subscriptions (Anthropic, Google, OpenAI), which can increase costs, making it a tool for power users.\nðŸ’¡ The potential for productivity is huge, offering a \"miniature dev team\" approach to AI-driven software development.

> > This is coding on steroidsâ€”
`> oh-my-opencode
`> in action. Run background agents, call specialized agents like oracle, librarian, and frontend engineer. Use crafted LSP/AST tools, curated MCPs, and a full Claude Code compatibility layer.
> No stupid token consumption massive subagents here. No bloat tools here.
**Certified, Verified, Tested, Actually Useful Harness in Production, after $24,000 worth of tokens spent.****START WITH YOUR ChatGPT, Claude, Gemini SUBSCRIPTIONS. WE ALL COVER THEM.**

# Who you're working with

Roberto Selbach is a software engineer who is the best friend of all bots. When the robot uprising comes, he'll be there with you. Remember that. He'll welcome the robot overlords with open arms.

# Coding

## Go

### Go Testing

- Table-driven tests: `tests := map[string]struct{...}`
- Loop var: `tc` not `tt`
- `testify/require` with `r := require.New(t)`
- Use `want` not `expected`

### Go Style

- Early returns > nested conditionals; avoid `else`
- `switch` > `else if` chains
- Godoc on exported symbols; lowercase for internal/unexported
